reasoning: Erosive esophagitis is complications of GERD with esophageal tissue damage. Limited specific incidence data; estimates based on proportion of GERD patients developing erosive changes (10-20%). Prevalence data more commonly reported (approximately 50-60 per 1000 GERD patients). Confidence moderate due to scarcity of disease-specific epidemiological studies.
source: Ronkainen J et al. (2005). Prevalence of Barrett's esophagus in the general population. Gut. 54(6):710-716
